docs.snippet: In pursuance of the resolutions, as announced in the TIMES of Sunday, the several Committees from the City of Brooklyn; which were appointed to meet Col. A.M. WOOD, of the New-York Fourteenth Regiment, went to Philadelphia on Saturday afternoon.

docs.abstract: Brig. Gen. Lander dies in Union camp, Virginia
docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. LANDER died at 4 P.M. to-day, in camp in Virginia, of congestion of the brain. He has been exceedingly unwell recently, and desired on that account to be relieved, but his fatal illness was of brie duration. Mrs. LANDER, formerly Miss J. M. DAVENPORT, of dramatic fame, is in Washington. A dis patch at 2 P.M. to-day, prepared her for the sad result.

docs.snippet: The telegraph brings the melancholy intelligence, this morning, ihat Brig.-Gen. FREDERICK W. LANDER, the fearless soldier, the bravest of the brave, died yesterday in camp at Pau Pau,Western Virginia, from the effect of his wound received in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The telegraph brings the melancholy intelligence, this morning, ihat Brig.-Gen. FREDERICK W. LANDER, the fearless soldier, the bravest of the brave, died yesterday in camp at Pau Pau,Western Virginia, from the effect of his wound received in the affair at Edwards' Ferry.
